page.title: 13BIRMINGHAM/BRISTOL RAILWAY
page.content: The lady we interviewed at{Oddingley {Crossing}had lived there for four years. She owns the house next door to the crossing, and works on a shift every other two days. During a day about fifty diesel engines come through, both passenger and freight. The points on the track are now electric, and are now worked by the Station at Gloucester. The crossing has a phone which is a direct link to Gloucester; it's an emergency phone for special cases, for example,if a train has broken down on the track. While we were there, the{Signal+Tele- {Communications}were there, laying wires which lead from Dunhampstead Signal Box to Oddingley Level Crossing. These men work in certain areas, and their particular area was from Swindon, Wilts to Herefordshire.
